titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of its records at Syracuse University
titlestmt.author: MPK

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Papers of the American publishing firm, including correspondence (1944-1966); general files, typescript manuscripts, production records, promotional material, books, and newspaper clippings.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: First established in 1943, Frederick Fell Publishers, Inc., is a trade independent book publisher in the United States, particularly strong in self-help and how-to titles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p:
The
Frederick Fell Publishers, Inc. Records is arranged in eight categories.

Correspondence is made up of letters both to and from Fell concerning business.
General files is comprised of his business associates.
Clippings and
Advertising contain promotional material.
Published material -- Other and
Published material are composed of books, transcripts, and rough drafts of books.
Memorabilia is composed of such items as address books, photographs, and a gag award.
Business records and apparatus contains corporate stock ledgers and Fell's corporate seal.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: Correspondence is in chronological order. General files are in alphabetical order. The remaining material is in no particular order.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: &scrc_name; has the records of several important American publishers, including Grove Press and Street and Smith. Please refer to the &subjindex; for a complete listing.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:
